extensionAdditionalInfo.info: This extension contains actions for communicating with a server using FTP.

actionInfo.name: Delete Files
actionInfo.summary: Deletes files on an FTP server.

extensionAdditionalInfo.actionInfo:
This action deletes files on an FTP server.

Action Fields

Server Name/Address

The name or IP address of the FTP server. If a port is not specified, the default FTP port (21) is used. For example, example.com or 192.168.1.1:2200.

User Name

The user name used to log in to the FTP server. If not specified, the action will attempt to log in anonymously.

Password

The password for the specified user name. This field is ignored if no user name is specified.

Server Path

The path on the FTP server to delete files from. This should be a standard FTP path. For example, /files/

Recursive

When checked, the action will recursively delete subfolders contained within the specified server path. When not checked, only files in the root path will be deleted.

Log Individual Files

When checked, BuildMaster will log the name of every deleted item in its action log. When not checked, only the number of items deleted is logged.

Remove Empty Directories

When checked, empty directories will also be removed by this action. When unchecked, only files will be removed.

actionInfo.name: Get Files
actionInfo.summary: Gets files from an FTP server.

extensionAdditionalInfo.actionInfo:
This action transfers files from an FTP server to a BuildMaster server/agent.

Action Fields

Server Name/Address

The name or IP address of the FTP server. If a port is not specified, the default FTP port (21) is used. For example, example.com or 192.168.1.1:2200.

User Name

The user name used to log in to the FTP server. If not specified, the action will attempt to log in anonymously.

Password

The password for the specified user name. This field is ignored if no user name is specified.

Server Path

The path on the FTP server to get files from. This should be a standard FTP path. For example, /files/

Files

The files to get from the server, relative to the specified server path. This may include wildcard characters.

Recursive

When checked, the action will recursively get subfolders contained within the specified server path. When not checked, only files in the root path will be transferred.

Log Individual Files

When checked, BuildMaster will log the name of every transferred item in its action log. When not checked, only the number of items transferred is logged.

Synchronize Files

When checked, the action will only transfer files from the FTP server if they have a new timestamp than a local copy of the file (or if the file does not exist at all locally). When not checked, everything matching the Files field is transferred.

actionInfo.name: Send Files
actionInfo.summary: Sends files to an FTP server.

extensionAdditionalInfo.actionInfo:
This action transfers files from a BuildMaster server/agent to an FTP server.

Action Fields

Server Name/Address

The name or IP address of the FTP server. If a port is not specified, the default FTP port (21) is used. For example, example.com or 192.168.1.1:2200.

User Name

The user name used to log in to the FTP server. If not specified, the action will attempt to log in anonymously.

Password

The password for the specified user name. This field is ignored if no user name is specified.

Server Path

The path on the FTP server to send files to. This should be a standard FTP path. For example, /files/

Files

The files to send to the server, relative to the specified source directory. This may include wildcard characters.

Recursive

When checked, the action will recursively send subfolders contained within the specified source path. When not checked, only files in the root path will be transferred.

Log Individual Files

When checked, BuildMaster will log the name of every transferred item in its action log. When not checked, only the number of items transferred is logged.

Synchronize Files

When checked, the action will only transfer files to the FTP server if they have a new timestamp than the remote copy of the file (or if the file does not exist at all on the server). When not checked, everything matching the Files field is transferred.
